title: Overall
stimulusHtml:
Essay will have most of the following qualities in varying degrees:

9-6 points: Stronger

Indicators for 9-8

  • Successfully sustains thesis: student demonstrates control of material.

  • Analyzes explicit ways in which the Scientific Revolution had an impact on both religion and philosophy.

  • Demonstrates relevant knowledge of the Scientific Revolution.

  • Supports the thesis with appropriate evidence.

  • May contain minor errors, or a single major error; even a 9 need not be flawless.

Indicators for 7-6

  • Has a clear thesis (even if implicit) developed throughout essay.

  • Includes some analysis of the impact of the Scientific Revolution on religion and philosophy.

  • Demonstrates some knowledge of the Scientific Revolution; may emphasize the Scientific Revolution over impact.

  • Supports the thesis with specific supporting evidence.

  • May contain a number of minor errors, or a single major error.

5-4 points: Mixed

Indicators

  • Thesis is superficial or simplistic or a stronger thesis weakly sustained.

  • Mentions impact of the Scientific Revolution on religion and philosophy with little analysis.

  • May focus primarily on the Scientific Revolution.

  • Contains inadequate or marginal supporting evidence.

  • May contain significant errors.

3-0 points: Weaker

Indicators for 3-2

  • Weak or limited thesis.

  • Makes little or no reference to the impact of the Scientific Revolution.

  • May be primarily polemical or partially off task.

  • Includes minimal concrete evidence.

  • May contain a number of major errors.

Indicators for 1-0

  • Essays scored 0 or 1 may attempt to address the question but fail to do so.

  • Thesis confused and unfocused.

  • Refers vaguely to the Scientific Revolution.

  • May be merely polemical and partially off task; may omit discussion of impact.

  • Evidence irrelevant or missing.

  • May contain a number of glaring errors.

  • Essay completely off task or blank.
